required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Low Field Magnetic Stimulation in Mood Disorders Using the LFMS Device
clinical_study.official_title: Low Field Magnetic Stimulation in Mood Disorders Using the LFMS Device

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to test whether low-field magnetic stimulation (LFMS) can relieve some of the symptoms of depression in bipolar disorder or major depression.

detailed_description.textblock: This study involves a screening visit with the study physician and a treatment visit. Participants will be asked to complete several questionnaires about their mood during both visits. The treatment visit will involve use of the LFMS device. Participants will place the top of their head inside the device for approximately 20 minutes. Participants will receive either the actual treatment or a sham treatment and will not know which they receive. This device produces weak electromagnetic fields. There is no discomfort or even sensation caused by the device. The device has been declared to be a "non-significant risk device" by the FDA, and there are no known risks associated with its use.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change in Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D) (17 Item) in Subjects With Bipolar Depression
primary_outcome.time_frame: Once just before and once just after treatment
primary_outcome.description: A multiple choice questionnaire used to rate depression severity. Mean change from pretreatment score. 17 items reflecting depression symptoms are scored on scale of severity; 9 items are scored 0 = Absent 1 = Trivial 2 = Mild 3 = Moderate 4 = Severe 8 items are scored 0 = Absent 1 = Mild 2 = Severe. Items are summed; minimum score is 0, maximum score is 52. Higher scores represent more severe depression.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change in Hamilton Depression Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D) (17 Item) in Subjects With Major Depressive Disorder
primary_outcome.time_frame: Once just before and once just after treatment
primary_outcome.description: A multiple choice questionnaire used to rate depression severity. Mean change from pretreatment score. 17 items reflecting depression symptoms are scored on scale of severity; 9 items are scored 0 = Absent 1 = Trivial 2 = Mild 3 = Moderate 4 = Severe 8 items are scored 0 = Absent 1 = Mild 2 = Severe. Items are summed; minimum score is 0, maximum score is 52. Higher scores represent more severe depression.

primary_outcome.measure: Visual Analog Scale (VAS) in Subjects With Bipolar Depression
primary_outcome.time_frame: Once just before and once just after treatment
primary_outcome.description: Eleven point Likert scales indicating immediate depression state. Mean change from pretreatment score. Participant marks an 'X' on a numbered line anchored by 0 = no depression and 10 = most depressed ever been.

primary_outcome.measure: Visual Analog Scale (VAS) in Subjects With Major Depressive Disorder
primary_outcome.time_frame: Once just before and once just after treatment
primary_outcome.description: Eleven point Likert scales indicating immediate depression state. Mean change from pretreatment score. Participant marks an 'X' on a numbered line anchored by 0 = no depression and 10 = most depressed ever been.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change in Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D) (17 Item): Combined Diagnostic Groups.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Once just before and once just after treatment
secondary_outcome.description: A multiple choice questionnaire used to rate depression severity. Mean change from pretreatment score. 17 items reflecting depression symptoms are scored on scale of severity; 9 items are scored 0 = Absent 1 = Trivial 2 = Mild 3 = Moderate 4 = Severe 8 items are scored 0 = Absent 1 = Mild 2 = Severe. Items are summed; minimum score is 0, maximum score is 52. Higher scores represent more severe depression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Visual Analog Scale (VAS): Combined Diagnostic Groups.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Once just before and once just after treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Eleven point Likert scales indicating immediate depression state. Mean change from pretreatment score. Participant marks an 'X' on a numbered line anchored by 0 = no depression and 10 = most depressed ever been.

secondary_outcome.measure: Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (PANAS) Positive Score: Combined Diagnostic Group.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Once just before and once just after treatment
secondary_outcome.description: 20 item list of words that describe different feelings and emotions with positive and negative valences (10 each), which the subject scores on a 1-5 scale: 1 = very slightly or not at all 2 = a little 3 = moderate 4 = quite a bit 5 = extremely. Positive and Negative scores are calculated and reported separately and range from 10-50. Higher positive score reflects stronger positive affect and higher negative score reflects stronger negative affect.

secondary_outcome.measure: Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (PANAS) Negative Score: Combined Diagnostic Group.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: once pre and once post LFMS treatment
secondary_outcome.description: 20 item list of words that describe different feelings and emotions with positive and negative valences (10 each), which the subject scores on a 1-5 scale: 1 = very slightly or not at all 2 = a little 3 = moderate 4 = quite a bit 5 = extremely. Positive and Negative scores are calculated and reported separately and range from 10-50. Higher positive score reflects stronger positive affect and higher negative score reflects stronger negative affect.

arm_group.description: 20 minutes of sham treatment with the Low Field Magnetic Stimulation Device (LFMS)in bipolar depressed subjects
20 minutes of active treatment with the Low Field Magnetic Stimulation Device (LFMS)in bipolar depressed subjects
20 minutes of sham treatment with the Low Field Magnetic Stimulation Device (LFMS) in major depressed subjects
20 minutes of active treatment with the Low Field Magnetic Stimulation Device (LFMS) in major depressed subjects

intervention.description: The LFMS Device is an electromagnetic coil situated on a cylinder with an inside diameter of 13.2 inches. It produces weak electromagnetic fields at a frequency of about 1 kHz; the magnetic fields are less than 30 Gauss and the electric fields are up to 1.43 V/m. Subjects will receive one 20 minute treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of Major Depressive Disorder or Bipolar Disorder; must be currently depressed
- May be medicated or unmedicated
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindication for MRI due to metal in eyes/head
- Claustrophobia.
- Inability to lie flat.
- History of brain injury.
- Pregnant
- Current drug use/abuse/dependence
- History of polysubstance use

link.description: Link to McLean Hospital clinical study website

reference.citation: Carlezon WA Jr, Rohan ML, Mague SD, Meloni EG, Parsegian A, Cayetano K, Tomasiewicz HC, Rouse ED, Cohen BM, Renshaw PF. Antidepressant-like effects of cranial stimulation within a low-energy magnetic field in rats. Biol Psychiatry. 2005 Mar 15;57(6):571-6.

Rohan M, Parow A, Stoll AL, Demopulos C, Friedman S, Dager S, Hennen J, Cohen BM, Renshaw PF. Low-field magnetic stimulation in bipolar depression using an MRI-based stimulator. Am J Psychiatry. 2004 Jan;161(1):93-8.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from March 2008 though February 2011. They were recruited through flyers distributed around McLean Hospital (Belmont, MA), referral by clinic doctors and direct recruitment on the hospital's units.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Enrolled participants are excluded from statistical results if they had baseline Hamilton Depression Rating scores under 17 or co-morbid disorders.

group.title: Bipolar Disorder Active LFMS Treatment
group.description: Subjects with bipolar depression receiving active treatment with the Low Field Magnetic Stimulation Device.

group.title: Bipolar Disorder Sham LFMS Treatment
group.description: Subjects with bipolar depression receiving sham treatment with the Low Field Magnetic Stimulation Device. The sham treatment is identical to the active treatment, with the exception that subjects to not receive the active stimulation.

group.title: Major Depressive Disorder Active LFMS Treatment
group.description: Subjects with major depression receiving active treatment with the Low Field Magnetic Stimulation Device.

group.title: Major Depressive Disorder Sham LFMS Treatment
group.description: Subjects with major depression receiving sham treatment with the Low Field Magnetic Stimulation Device. The sham treatment is identical to the active treatment, with the exception that subjects to not receive the active stimulation.

baseline.population: Enrolled participants are excluded from statistical results if they had baseline Hamilton Depression Rating scores under 17 or co-morbid disorders.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Mean Change in Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D) (17 Item): Combined Diagnostic Groups.
outcome.description: A multiple choice questionnaire used to rate depression severity. Mean change from pretreatment score. 17 items reflecting depression symptoms are scored on scale of severity; 9 items are scored 0 = Absent 1 = Trivial 2 = Mild 3 = Moderate 4 = Severe 8 items are scored 0 = Absent 1 = Mild 2 = Severe. Items are summed; minimum score is 0, maximum score is 52. Higher scores represent more severe depression.
outcome.time_frame: Once just before and once just after treatment
outcome.population: Qualifying subjects who completed the the study with qualifying HAM-D scores and complete data.

group.title: Combined Group Active LFMS Treatment
group.description: Combined diagnostic groups receiving active treatment with the Low Field Magnetic Stimulation Device.

group.title: Combined Group Sham LFMS Treatment
group.description: Combined diagnostic groups receiving sham treatment with the Low Field Magnetic Stimulation Device. The sham treatment is identical to the active treatment, with the exception that subjects to not receive the active stimulation.

measure.title: Mean Change in Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D) (17 Item): Combined Diagnostic Groups.
measure.description: A multiple choice questionnaire used to rate depression severity. Mean change from pretreatment score. 17 items reflecting depression symptoms are scored on scale of severity; 9 items are scored 0 = Absent 1 = Trivial 2 = Mild 3 = Moderate 4 = Severe 8 items are scored 0 = Absent 1 = Mild 2 = Severe. Items are summed; minimum score is 0, maximum score is 52. Higher scores represent more severe depression.
measure.population: Qualifying subjects who completed the the study with qualifying HAM-D scores and complete data.

analysis.groups_desc: Active LFMS treatment would reduce depression immediately after treatment in subjects with bipolar depression and those with major depressive disorder as assessed by the 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale.
analysis.p_value_desc: We used type HC3 robust standard errors (SEs)in place of OLS regression SEs to guard against biased estimation of SEs due to heteroscedasticity. This is an uncorrected p-value with a required threshold of 0.025 for significance (correction factor 2).
analysis.method_desc: Bonferroni multiple testing corrections were applied separately to results for our primary and secondary outcomes.

outcome.title: Visual Analog Scale (VAS): Combined Diagnostic Groups.
outcome.description: Eleven point Likert scales indicating immediate depression state. Mean change from pretreatment score. Participant marks an 'X' on a numbered line anchored by 0 = no depression and 10 = most depressed ever been.
outcome.time_frame: Once just before and once just after treatment
outcome.population: Qualifying subjects who completed the the study with qualifying HAM-D scores.

group.title: Bipolar Disorder Sham LFMS Treatment
group.description: Subjects with bipolar depression receiving sham treatment with the Low Field Magnetic Stimulation Device. The sham treatment is identical to the active treatment, with the exception that subjects to not receive the active stimulation.

measure.title: Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (PANAS) Negative Score in Subjects With Bipolar Depression
measure.description: 20 item list of words that describe different feelings and emotions with positive and negative valences (10 each), which the subject scores on a 1-5 scale: 1 = very slightly or not at all 2 = a little 3 = moderate 4 = quite a bit 5 = extremely. Positive and Negative scores are calculated and reported separately and range from 10-50. Higher positive score reflects stronger positive affect and higher negative score reflects stronger negative affect.
measure.population: Qualifying subjects who completed the the study with qualifying HAM-D scores and complete data.

analysis.groups_desc: Active LFMS treatment would reduce depression immediately after treatment in subjects with bipolar depression as assessed by the PANAS (negative scale)
analysis.p_value_desc: we used type HC3 robust standard errors (SEs)in place of OLS regression SEs to guard against biased estimation of SEs due to heteroscedasticity. This is an uncorrected p-value with a required threshold of 0.0125 for significance (correction factor 4)
analysis.method_desc: Bonferroni multiple testing corrections were applied separately to results for our primary and secondary outcomes.

outcome.title: Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (PANAS) Negative Score in Subjects With Major Depressive Disorder
outcome.description: 20 item list of words that describe different feelings and emotions with positive and negative valences (10 each), which the subject scores on a 1-5 scale: 1 = very slightly or not at all 2 = a little 3 = moderate 4 = quite a bit 5 = extremely. Positive and Negative scores are calculated and reported separately and range from 10-50. Higher positive score reflects stronger positive affect and higher negative score reflects stronger negative affect.
outcome.time_frame: once pre and once post LFMS treatment
outcome.population: Qualifying subjects who completed the the study with qualifying HAM-D scores and complete data.

group.title: Major Depressive Disorder Active LFMS Treatment
group.description: Subjects with major depression receiving active treatment with the Low Field Magnetic Stimulation Device.

group.title: Major Depressive Disorder Sham LFMS Treatment
group.description: Subjects with major depression receiving sham treatment with the Low Field Magnetic Stimulation Device. The sham treatment is identical to the active treatment, with the exception that subjects to not receive the active

measure.title: Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (PANAS) Negative Score in Subjects With Major Depressive Disorder
measure.description: 20 item list of words that describe different feelings and emotions with positive and negative valences (10 each), which the subject scores on a 1-5 scale: 1 = very slightly or not at all 2 = a little 3 = moderate 4 = quite a bit 5 = extremely. Positive and Negative scores are calculated and reported separately and range from 10-50. Higher positive score reflects stronger positive affect and higher negative score reflects stronger negative affect.
measure.population: Qualifying subjects who completed the the study with qualifying HAM-D scores and complete data.

analysis.groups_desc: Active LFMS treatment would reduce depression immediately after treatment in subjects with major depressive disorder as assessed by the PANAS (negative scale)
analysis.p_value_desc: we used type HC3 robust standard errors (SEs)in place of OLS regression SEs to guard against biased estimation of SEs due to heteroscedasticity. This is an uncorrected p-value with a required threshold of 0.0125 for significance (correction factor 4)
analysis.method_desc: Bonferroni multiple testing corrections were applied separately to results for our primary and secondary outcomes.

group.description: Subjects with bipolar depression receiving active treatment with the Low Field Magnetic Stimulation Device.

event.description: dizziness at the sight of blood - psychological

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: A limitation of the current trial was that it was underpowered to detect moderate but clinically significant benefits of LFMS in diagnostic subgroups.
